abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey satisfactory
            outcomes, likely sustainability, and high institutional
            development impacts. Lessons learned suggest the following.
            Sector work should be given particular attention, since
            structural or institutional changes in the sector may occur
            between the time sector studies are conducted, and the time
            appraisal takes place, specifically, in identifying sector
            constraints, and evaluating both the implementing agency
            capacity, and the selection criteria for participating
            enterprises. On the business environment, participating
            enterprises must be willing to innovate, build sound
            management teams, and prepare a realistic business plan.
            Likewise, the competitiveness of foreign currency
            denominated loans for sub-borrowers should be evaluated, in
            particular when the major investment items - equipment and
            works - are locally available, and major project outputs are
            destined for domestic market. Under these circumstances,
            foreign exchange risks, and more competitive local currency
            loans tend to discourage the use of dollar denominated
            loans. Finally, financial intermediaries should be chosen
            based on their local knowledge, i.e., conducting a thorough
            research on the intermediary's prior sector, and
            regional experience.
